alert.note: Alert for Houston; Montgomery; Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 11 at 10:46PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Montgomery, southern Stewart and Houston Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1045 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Paris Landing State Park, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Erin, Tennessee Ridge, Cumberland City and Houston County Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
